titleStmt.title: A little pamphlet entituled the ladder of paradise Very worthy and needful to be read of every Christian that is willing to tread the steps which lead to heauen.
Scala paradisi. English.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A22897 of text S115844 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 937). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 47 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 23 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A little pamphlet entituled the ladder of paradise Very worthy and needful to be read of every Christian that is willing to tread the steps which lead to heauen.

titleStmt.author: Augustine, Saint, Bishop of Hippo, attributed name.
Guigo II, d. 1188, attributed name.
T. W., fl. 1573-1595.

publicationStmt.publisher: [By J. Allde?] for Edward Aggas, dwelling in Paules church yard ..,

notesStmt.note: "From the Scala Paradisi, now attributed to Guigo II, General of the Carthusians."--STC.
Printer's name and publication date conjectured by STC.
Running title reads: The ladder to paradise.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
